title: Add constraints between multiple labels
body:
So I took a look at #877 where it is stated, that each label has a group.
Now I cannot seem to find any grouping mechanic in the UI:
![Bildschirmfoto 2022-11-02 um 15 33 29](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35855749/199517250-930e8d4b-449f-462b-a38a-abb924fe2a39.png)

I am trying to setup a text classification project where we will have multiple classes/categories that will need labeling on one specific sample.
E.g.: We will have an email as input and we will need to label two different things:
1. Which product is mentioned in this mail? e.g. ProductA, ProductB or ProductC
2. Which company is responsible for this product? e.g. Google, Amazon or Microsoft

For now I could only setup either one label only or multiple labels where I cannot assure that my annotators will choose only one product and one company. E.g.: An annotator could label an email as Google, Amazon and ProductC, even though only (Google, ProductC) or (Amazon, ProductC) would be a valid choice.

Is there any way to set this up?

Your Environment
---------


*   Operating System: Mac OS
*   Python Version Used: 3.9
*   When you install doccano: 28.10.2022
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): docker-compose
